sentences.en: "But Ian's such a simpleton", she laughed.
sentences.cn: “可是伊恩太傻了，”她笑着说道。

sentences.en: "I'll be astonished if I win on Sunday," laughed Lyle.
sentences.cn: “我要是星期天能赢那就真是奇了怪了，”莱尔笑道。

sentences.en: "We could do with some help from our friends," he laughed.
sentences.cn: “如果我们朋友来帮助就好了，”他笑着说道。

sentences.en: Even Ford, who seldom smiled, laughed out loud a few times.
sentences.cn: 即使是很少笑的福特，有几次也笑出声来。

sentences.en: He laughed and ran his fingers through his hair.
sentences.cn: 他笑了，用手指拢了拢他的头发。

sentences.en: He laughed it off with aristocratic indifference.
sentences.cn: 他带着贵族式的漠然对其一笑置之。

sentences.en: He turned his good eye on me and laughed.
sentences.cn: 他用那只健全的眼睛看着我笑了。

sentences.en: He was about to offer an explanation, but she was beginning to laugh.
sentences.cn: 他刚要加以解释，她就开始笑起来了。
她的朋友们也放声大笑起来。

sentences.en: I just couldn't laugh at his jokes the way I used to.
sentences.cn: 我就是不能像以前那样笑他讲的笑话。

sentences.en: Jerrold laughed again, a solid, fruity laugh.
sentences.cn: 杰罗尔德又笑了，声音浑厚而圆润。

sentences.en: Kate laughed, and sank down again to her seat.
sentences.cn: 凯特笑了，又坐回到她的座位上。

sentences.en: Six months ago she would have laughed at the idea.
sentences.cn: 要是在6个月前，她会对这个想法嗤之以鼻。

sentences.en: Suddenly he laughed again, this time with a cold, sharp tone.
sentences.cn: 突然他又笑了，这次笑得冷漠、刺耳。

sentences.en: The couple laughed off rumours that their marriage was in trouble.
sentences.cn: 夫妻两人对他们婚姻出现问题的谣言一笑置之。
他俩都纵情地笑了起来。

phrases.tran_cn: [美国俚语]为了取乐，当作消遣，借以开心
v. 笑在最后；取得最后胜利
不信任的嘲笑；大声狂笑；哈哈大笑
用笑驱除恐惧等；付之一笑；谈笑中消磨时间

trans.tran_en: When you laugh, you make a sound with your throat while smiling and show that you are happy or amused. People also sometimes laugh when they feel nervous or are being unfriendly.

trans.tran_cn: 笑( laugh的过去式和过去分词 )，发笑，嘲笑，（特别表示因成功而）处于有利地位
